Title: Little Women
Cast: Katharine Hepburn, Joan Bennett, Paul Lukas, Edna May Oliver, Jean Parker, Frances Dee, Henry Stephenson, Douglass Montgomery, John Lodge, Spring Byington, Samuel S. Hinds, Mabel Colcord, Marion Ballou, Nydia Westman, Harry Beresford

See full summary » Little Women is a "coming of age" drama tracing the lives of four sisters: Meg, Jo, Beth and Amy. During the American Civil War, the girls father is away serving as a minister to the troops. The family, headed by thier beloved Marmee, must struggle to make ends meet, with the help of their kind and wealthy neighbor, Mr. Laurence, and his high spirited grandson Laurie. Written by Liza Esser <essereli@student.msu.edu>
Keywords: american civil war, neighbor, scarlet fever, proposal, love
Location: Lancaster's Lake, Sunland, Los Angeles, California, USA
Actors: Katharine Hepburn, Joan Bennett, Paul Lukas
Writer: Louisa May Alcott (by) (as Louisa M. Alcott), Sarah Y. Mason (screen play) | 1 more credit »
Description: Directed by George Cukor.  With Katharine Hepburn, Joan Bennett, Paul Lukas, Edna May Oliver. Little Women is a "coming of age" drama tracing the lives of four sisters: Meg, Jo, Beth and Amy. During the American Civil War, the girls father is away serving as a minister to the troops. The family, headed by thier beloved Marmee, must struggle to make ends meet, with the help of their kind and wealthy neighbor, Mr. Laurence, and his high spirited grandson Laurie.
